primary

Class ChessPlayGui

  • java.lang.Object
    • Application
      • primary.ChessPlayGui

  • public class ChessPlayGui
extends Application
    I have officially begun using GitHub, and this lame, un-original little project will be my first go at it. It is essentially playing with creation of a well-documented API, then being used in a graphical interface. Pretty pointless, but a good test of proper coding conventions.
    Author:
    ethanarns

      • ChessPlayGui

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • init

        public void init()
        This class is everything called after the main method calls launch(). You cannot do any actual work with the stage itself here, but for sake of clarity, do all non-stage setup in here.

      • start

        public void start(Stage primaryStage)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        The method that actually starts the gui. Do all Stage construction here, and do other initializations in the init() method
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • initToolbar

        public void initToolbar()
        Graphical initialization of the toolbar. Assumes toolbar is declared but not initialized, as well as the buttons

      • initMoves

        public void initMoves()
        Graphical initialization of moves pane. Assumes moves is not initialized but that it has been declared

      • printMove

        public void printMove(java.lang.String output)
        Updates the move list on the right side with the input string. If it would overflow, it removes the first and reprints in order to give it a scrolling effect.
        Parameters:
        output - string that should be added to move list pane

      • getClickPos

        public Position getClickPos(double eventX,
                   double eventY)
        Translates a click somewhere on the board GridePane into a computer- friendly chess location as a Position object. Checks if click is inside the boundaries, returns null if not on a square.
        Parameters:
        eventX - the event.getX() input
        eventY - the event.getY() input
        Returns:
        adjusted position if valid, null if invalid

      • squareClicked

        public void squareClicked(Position pos)
        This should be called upon a square being clicked on the board pane. It first does a bunch of input tests, then checks if the click itself is legal based on current turn and whether or not the user is looking to place a piece on a blank space or an enemy piece. It initiates the move logic if all requirements are met.
        It also works with the move history list, and prints the move. It also checks for piece capture, and will also print that to the history list.
        Parameters:
        pos - the position of the square clicked

      • setSquareSelectedColor

        public void setSquareSelectedColor(Position pos)
        A method that sets the square at the selected color to an appropriate selection color. It first updates the board, as to clear any other selection colors. The fill color is Color.LIGHTGRAY, the stroke is Color.GRAY.
        Parameters:
        pos - position to set to select color

      • initBoard

        public void initBoard()
        Initializes the board variable as a GridPane. It then adds in graphics representing blank spaces, sets the mouse event for square click recognition, and initiates the square selection variable and whether or not the user is looking to move, which should initially be false.

      • updateBoard

        public void updateBoard()
        Takes the data from the existing chess matrix and places it on the graphical board object

      • resetBoard

        public void resetBoard()
        Resets chess matrix, then updates graphical board to reflect the change

      • placePiece

        public void placePiece(Piece p)
        Places a Piece object onto the chess matrix, then updates the board to reflect that
        Parameters:
        p - piece to place

      • getSymbol

        public java.lang.String getSymbol(java.lang.String input)
        Converts symbol of input String to actual chess character to be placed on the board
        Parameters:
        input - input string
        Returns:
        string that is an actual chess graphic, or empty space

      • stop

        public void stop()
        A safe method of stopping. System.exit() works too, but with Platform.exit(), this little method gets called, and allows for things like saving on close etc. This is not to be manually called, only by the Application run itself
